name: JobPrize
tag_list: job-search, employment, jobs, employment-search, pay-for-jobs, job-bounty
overview:
Would you pay $500 to someone to help you land a $75k a year job?

JobPrize is a job referral network that allows Job Seekers to pay informed employees to refer and help them land a job.

Jobprize is a Job Referral Network where job seekers can post a profile of their qualifications and be seen by employees willing to give them a referral. In this economy, we need to find new ways to bring unemployment from out of a slump. Companies have open positions that need to be filled, but are not effectively advertised. Job seekers need jobs, but do not have the contacts to refer them, or yet has spent hundreds of hours submitting jobs through websites and filling out applications with no luck. Your best bet? Profile yourself on JobPrize and you are one step closer to being seen by people willing to refer you to a position which you qualify for.

Thats the idea behind JobPrize. Job seekers can work within their personal network or allow worldwide Prize Hunters to refer them to a position within the Prize Hunters company.

Here is how it works, New College Grads, Seasoned Employees, or Entry Level individuals can sign up for an account at JobPrize.com. Post a profile which includes the type of job being sought. Once submitted, prize hunters can search the site for profiles that matches openings within their industry. If they find one, they can match it up to their company database and refer you, the job seeker to the position. In many instances, companies offer a referral bonus, so the prize hunter can choose to take this bonus directly from their company.

Because most jobs are landed through referrals, this will ultimately lead to a more fruitful job search and put our network of prize hunters to work for you cutting hundreds of hours of search time and allowing job seekers to focus on what is important, building your skills. So should you profile yourself on JobPrize and be seen by people willing to give you a referral? Its worth it.
